title: Highest Net ODA Received as a Percentage of Government Expense
description: In 2020, Somalia received net official development assistance (ODA) amounting to 16,588,979% of its central government expenses, indicating a heavy reliance on international aid.

title: Complete Multilateral Debt Service
description: By 2023, Somalia's multilateral debt service accounted for 100% of its public and publicly guaranteed debt service, highlighting a significant financial obligation to international lenders.

title: Predominant Agricultural Water Use
description: In 2021, 99.48% of Somalia's total freshwater withdrawals were used for agriculture, underscoring the sector's dominance in water consumption.

title: High Customs and Import Duties
description: Customs and other import duties made up 67.57% of Somalia's tax revenue in 2023, reflecting a significant reliance on trade taxes.

title: Severe Particulate Emission Damage
description: In 2021, particulate emission damage was equivalent to 7.09% of Somalia's GNI, indicating substantial environmental and economic impacts.

title: High Prevalence of Female Genital Mutilation
description: As of 2020, 99.2% of females in Somalia were affected by female genital mutilation, highlighting a critical human rights issue.

title: Significant Undernourishment
description: In 2022, 51.3% of Somalia's population was undernourished, reflecting severe food insecurity challenges.

title: High Fertility Rate
description: Somalia's fertility rate stood at 6.13 births per woman in 2023, indicating a rapidly growing population.

title: Large Young Female Population
description: In 2023, 18.32% of Somalia's female population was aged 0-4, suggesting a youthful demographic structure.

title: Dependence on Imports from Low- and Middle-Income Economies
description: 75.32% of Somalia's merchandise imports in 2023 came from low- and middle-income economies outside its region, indicating a diverse import base.

title: Strong Export Ties with the Arab World
description: In 2023, 90.84% of Somalia's merchandise exports were directed to economies in the Arab World, highlighting significant trade relationships.

title: Lowest Revenue Excluding Grants as a Percentage of GDP
description: In 2023, Somalia's revenue excluding grants was only 0.0001% of its GDP, indicating a significant reliance on external financial support.

title: Minimal Tax Revenue as a Percentage of GDP
description: Somalia's tax revenue in 2023 was a mere 0.00008% of GDP, reflecting challenges in domestic revenue generation.

title: Low School Enrollment Rates
description: In 2023, primary school enrollment in Somalia was 21.2%, with secondary enrollment at just 3.3%, highlighting educational access challenges.

title: Minimal Health Expenditure Per Capita
description: Somalia's current health expenditure per capita was $15.35 in 2022, indicating limited investment in health services.

title: Low Contraceptive Prevalence Among Married Women
description: In 2019, only 0.9% of married women in Somalia used any modern contraceptive method, reflecting limited access to family planning services.

title: Limited Prenatal Care Coverage
description: As of 2019, only 31.1% of pregnant women in Somalia received prenatal care, indicating gaps in maternal health services.

title: Low Efficiency in Customs Clearance
description: In 2022, Somalia scored 1.5 out of 5 in the efficiency of customs clearance process, suggesting logistical challenges in trade.

title: Low Rule of Law Estimate
description: Somalia's rule of law estimate in 2023 was -2.21, indicating significant governance challenges.

title: Minimal Trademark Applications by Nonresidents
description: In 2021, there were only 140 trademark applications by nonresidents in Somalia, reflecting limited foreign business interest.

title: Low Educational Attainment Among Adults
description: In 2022, only 15.5% of the population aged 25+ had completed primary education, highlighting educational attainment challenges.
